tmt.dafu.util module¶

tmt.dafu.util.build_global_ids(ids)[source]¶

Build global, continuous ids from local, image site specific ids.

Parameters:ids (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – dataset of size nx4 with the following columns: “{object name}_ID_site” “{object name}_ID_row” “{object name}_ID_column” “{object name}_ID_object”
Returns:
Return type:pandas.core.series.Series
tmt.dafu.util.calc_global_centroids(local_centroids, ids, image_size)[source]¶

Calculate global centroids from local, image site specific coordinates.

Parameters:
  • local_centroids (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – size nx2, where n is the number of objects, and the columns are the y, x coordinates of each object at the local site (i.e. in the image)
  • ids (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – dataset of size nx4 with the following columns: “{object name}_ID_site” “{object name}_ID_row” “{object name}_ID_column” “{object name}_ID_object”
  • image_size (Tuple[int]) – dimensions of an individual image, i.e. site
Returns:

dataset with dimensions nx2 and columns “y” and “x”
Return type:

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame
tmt.dafu.util.extract_ids(data_file, current_obj)[source]¶

Extract ids of the currently analyzed objects and their parent objects from the dataset. They represent the original local ids, i.e. they map to objects in single acquisition site images rather in contrast to global ids which map to objects in the stitched mosaic image. These local ids can be used to discard certain objects, such as border objects, from single site images before stitching.

Parameters:
  • data_file (str) – path to data.h5 HDF5 file that contains the dataset
  • current_obj (str) – name of currently analyzed objects
Returns:

with ids for current objects and their corresponding parent objects
Return type:

Tuple[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame]
tmt.dafu.util.image_name_from_joblist(joblist, data_filename)[source]¶

Determine the name of an image file from a YAML joblist description.

Parameters:
  • joblist (List[Dict[str, str]]) – joblist description for each job
  • data_filename (str) – name of a data HDF5 file that encodes the job id
Returns:

filename
Return type:

str
